Simulate normal data for kmeans tests

Source: R/tests.R
simulate_data.Rd

Creates nclust clusters normally distributed around 1:nclust

simulate_data(
  n = 100,
  sd = 0.3,
  nclust = 30,
  dims = 2,
  frac_na = NULL,
  add_true_clust = TRUE
)

Arguments

n

number of observations per cluster
sd

sd
nclust

number of clusters
dims

number of dimensions
frac_na

fraction of NA in the first dimension
add_true_clust

add a column with the true cluster ids

Value

simulated data

Examples

simulate_data(n = 100, sd = 0.3, nclust = 5, dims = 2)

#> # A tibble: 500 × 4
#>       id    V1    V2 true_clust
#>    <int> <dbl> <dbl>      <int>
#>  1     1 0.950 1.25           1
#>  2     2 1.04  1.38           1
#>  3     3 0.801 0.787          1
#>  4     4 0.841 0.894          1
#>  5     5 0.910 0.675          1
#>  6     6 0.819 1.29           1
#>  7     7 0.905 0.856          1
#>  8     8 1.09  0.688          1
#>  9     9 1.24  1.06           1
#> 10    10 1.53  1.51           1
#> # … with 490 more rows

# add 20% missing data
simulate_data(n = 100, sd = 0.3, nclust = 5, dims = 2, frac_na = 0.2)

#> # A tibble: 500 × 4
#>       id     V1    V2 true_clust
#>    <int>  <dbl> <dbl>      <int>
#>  1     1 NA     0.583          1
#>  2     2 NA     1.13           1
#>  3     3  0.705 1.09           1
#>  4     4  0.849 1.06           1
#>  5     5  1.30  0.863          1
#>  6     6  1.66  1.24           1
#>  7     7  0.950 1.08           1
#>  8     8 NA     1.00           1
#>  9     9 NA     1.60           1
#> 10    10 NA     1.09           1
#> # … with 490 more rows
